transportAdvice: Nagoya has an efficient subway and bus network that connects major tourist attractions, making public transit the most practical way to get around; taxis are widely available but more expensive. Walking is feasible within central districts, though the city is spread out enough that transit is recommended for reaching outlying sights.

weather.description: Cold and dry winter days with occasional frost, but snowfall is infrequent and skies are often clear.
Still cold with crisp air, though late February can bring the first hints of approaching spring.
Temperatures begin to rise and early cherry blossoms may appear toward month's end, with occasional rain showers.
Pleasant spring weather with cherry blossoms in full bloom early in the month and comfortable sightseeing conditions.
Warm and largely sunny, one of the most enjoyable months to visit before summer heat and humidity set in.
The rainy season brings frequent overcast skies and persistent rainfall, making waterproof gear essential.
Hot and very humid with intense heat; the rainy season typically ends mid-month but muggy conditions persist.
The hottest month of the year with oppressive heat and humidity; stay hydrated and seek air-conditioned spaces.
Typhoon season peaks and heavy rain is possible; temperatures remain warm and humidity stays elevated.
Autumn brings cooler, comfortable temperatures and beautiful foliage, making this an excellent time to visit.
Cool and dry with vivid autumn colors still visible early in the month and pleasant conditions for exploring.
Cold winter weather sets in with dry air and occasional frosty nights, though festive illuminations brighten the city.
